results.title: Fish spoilage control
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon illustrating bacteriological contamination of fish and correct methods of handling to ensure freshness from boat to dinner table. The spoilage process is portrayed by battalions of little red demons, who march in full invading force upon the hapless forms of freshly caught fish. They demonstrate effectively how every act of carelessness in fish handling will increase their numbers, and also how proper refrigeration and sanitary handling will rout them.

results.title: Fish in farm dams
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation and John Gacy
results.brief_description: Shows aspects of the native warm water fish breeding program being carried out at the Island Fisheries Research Station, Narrandera, NSW. Also looks at the work being done by State Fisheries and the Water Resources Commission which benefits farmers.

results.title: Fish embryo from fertilization to hatching
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sidney Goldsmith and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
Illustrates how fish eggs are fertilised in a stream, then traces the development of the zygote from the first cell cleavage to the formation of a young fish. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Fish and their characteristics
results.brief_description: Underwater photography introduces the characteristics of fish and shows how this group of vertebrates is fitted for its environment. Illustrates the variety of form, protective devices and reproductive methods in different types of fish. Distinguishes true fish from other marine animals and studies the freshwater perch as a representative fish.

results.title: Fish and chips cooking library. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Simple recipes garnished with humour and a smattering of hints and tips are demonstrated by Peter Doyle of the Sydney restaurant family. He shows you everything you need to know about how to make delicious seafood meals, including how to cook a fish in your dishwasher. The video is accompanied by a recipe booklet which also includes charts which show you which fish to substitute for another, and when particular fish are in season. The video is also time coded so that you can find the recipe you want, quickly and easily.

results.title: Fish
results.brief_description: The purchase of several goldfish signals the beginning of a learning adventure in the classroom for a group of students. Introduces the anatomy of the fish and its means of locomotion. Demonstrates experiments that are designed to discover whether goldfish can discriminate between colors.

results.title: Fish
results.creator_credit: Hafiz Zamri and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description: An allegorical tale of struggle and survival in a competitive world. Filmed in black and white this rather tragic story contains some disturbing scenes. Uses hand-drawn animation, music soundtrack and no commentary.
